summary: AN ORDINANCE relating to firefighting, life-safety and other emergency response facilities; providing for the submission to the voters of the City, at an election to be held therein on November 4, 2003, in conjunction with the state general election to be held on the same date, of a proposition authorizing the City to incur indebtedness by issuing its general obligation bonds, payable by annual property tax levies to be made in excess of regular property tax levies, for the purpose of paying all or a part of the cost of designing, constructing, acquiring, improving, renovating, and equipping firefighting, life-safety, and other emergency response facilities and authorizing the City to levy those excess property taxes; and establishing an oversight committee.
